paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a novel pathogenic variant in the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Index case: 53 years old, female, Wolof ethnicity; 3 sisters and 1 daughter also carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Moderately differentiated triple negative ductal adenocarcinoma of the right breast.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The index case was a 53-years-old woman of Wolof ethnicity who died at age 54 from moderately differentiated triple negative ductal adenocarcinoma of the right breast.
The pathogenic variant was also identified in three sisters and one daughter.
The pathogenic variant was also identified in three sisters and one daughter.
The pathogenic variant was also identified in three sisters and one daughter.
The pathogenic variant was also identified in three sisters and one daughter.

functional_data.summary: The variant is predicted to introduce a premature stop codon at position 1740 of the BRCA2 protein.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was likely transmitted to the index case by her mother, who was not diagnosed with breast cancer but has a sister who died of breast cancer.
variants.population_frequency: Not detected in any participant from the two control groups (healthy and sporadic breast cancer groups).
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on family segregation and absence in controls.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first report of this novel BRCA2 pathogenic variant in a Senegalese family.
key_quotes: This is the first report of a novel BRCA2 pathogenic variant in a Senegalese family with hereditary breast cancer.
The pathogenic variant was also identified in three sisters and one daughter, but was absent in the controls and unrelated cases.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
